fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_notes: The question text between contemporary and historical differ in inclusion of "within 12 months of the election". In contemporary it is excluded while included in historical.
fxInfo_question: Following this national election, did winners assume office according to prescribed constitutional rules and norms?

fxInfo_responses.value: No. The official winner of the election was prevented from assuming office by unconstitutional means.
Partially. The official winner/winning party or largest vote-getter was forced at least in part by unconstitutional means to share power, or delay assuming power for more than 6 months.
Yes. Constitutional rules and norms were followed and the official winner/winning party or largest vote-getter assumed office accordingly (or continued in office).

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2elasmoff, *_osp, *_ord
